examples: She got no credit for solving the problem.
I do the work, and you get the credit — how is that fair?
Her boss took credit for it.
So many people were involved in this, I can't take all of the credit.
I gave him credit for (= thought that he would have) better judgment than he showed.
If a member of my team comes up with a great idea, I'm happy to give them the credit.

body_content.explanation: used to say that someone should be praised for something, although there may be other things about them that are not good:
examples: To his credit, he is honest about the problems the business faces.

body_content.explanation: to do something that makes a person, group, or organization feel proud or receive praise:
examples: She is a credit to her family.

body_content.explanation: someone has done well or behaved well in a way that means someone connected with them should receive praise:
examples: She does her teachers credit.

body_content.explanation: something should cause a person to receive praise:
examples: Their actions do them credit.

body_content.explanation: used to show that you think a person deserves a lot of praise for something that they have done:
examples: All credit to her, she did it all herself.

body_content.explanation: a method of paying for goods or services at a later time, usually paying interest as well as the original money:
examples: They decided to buy the car on credit.
The shop was offering six months' interest-free credit on electronic goods.
I was relieved to see from my statement that my account was in credit.
If the cardholder has enough credit in their account to cover the sale, the transaction is authorized.

body_content.explanation: an amount of money paid into an account:
examples: The refund appeared will appear as a credit on your bill.
I phoned the bank when confusing debits and credits appeared on my bank statement.

body_content.explanation: a unit that represents a successfully finished part of an educational course:
examples: Each of these classes is worth three credits.

body_content.explanation: a list of people who helped to make a film or a television or radio programme, that is shown or announced at the beginning or the end of it:
examples: Everyone in the cinema was in tears by the time the credits rolled.

body_content.explanation: to pay money into a bank account:
examples: They credited my account with $20 after I pointed out the mistake.

body_content.explanation: to believe something that seems unlikely to be true:
examples: He even tried to pretend he was my son - can you credit it?
It was hard to credit some of the stories we heard about her.
